Boulder.Modele

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • Boulder.Modele.GameState

  • public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
    Level class, describes a complete level, the level is made up of a Bidimentional array of Cases, and a refreshment table
    See Also:
    Entity

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int dscore 
      private boolean fini 
      private int hauteur 
      private int longueur 
      private Player perso 
      private int score 
      private ExitDoor sortie 
      private Entity[][] tableau
      level grid table
      private float tmax 
      private java.util.List<Entity> UpTable
      update table, contains the cases that can be modified in the next cycle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameState()
      Creates a Level of 60 * 40 with the character at the top left and the exit at the bottom right
      GameState(int l, int h)
      creates a level of l*h filled with mud and with a border of Wall Indestructible
      GameState(java.lang.String path)
      creates a new level from a saved level

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void AddDscore()
      Decreases the number of diamonds to find
      void addToScore(int value)
      add the value passed as a parameter to the score
      void addUptable(int x, int y)
      add in the update table the case whose position is transmitted
      void cleanUpTable()
      clean up the Updatetable of the elements that do not move

      Changes the two boxes to the positions that are passed in parameters
      Entity getCase(int x, int y)
      show a level in text public void afficheDebug() { int x, y; for (y = 0; y < hauteur; y++) { for (x = 0; x < longueur; x++) { System.out.print(tableau[x][y].ID() + " "); } System.out.print("\n"); } System.out.print(UpTable.size()); System.out.println(UpTable.toString()); System.out.println("diamond :" + dscore); }
      int getDscore()
      recovers the number of diamonds needed to finish the level, returns 0 if negative
      int getHauteur()
      get the height of the level
      int getLongueur()
      retrieves the length of the level
      Player getPerso()
      get the character
      int getScore()
      retrieves the level score
      ExitDoor getSortie()
      get the exit
      int getTmax()
      Retrieves the player's remaining bonus time, returns 0 if negative
      Entity[] getUpTable()
      retrieves the update table in a table
      void importer(java.lang.String niveau)
      import the level in csv which is at the specified path
      void insereBoue(int x, int y)
      insert mud at the position indicated as an argument
      void insereDiamant(int x, int y)
      insert a diamond at the position indicated in the argument and add it in the UpTable
      void insereMurIndestructible(int x, int y)
      inserts an indestructible wall at the position specified as an argument
      void insereMurNormal(int x, int y) 
      void inserePapillon(int x, int y)
      insert a butterfly at the position indicated in argument and add it in the UpTable
      void inserePersonage(int x, int y)
      insert the character in the level at the position indicated in argument if a character is already present then he is exchanged with his new position
      void insereRocher(int x, int y)
      insert a boulder at the position indicated as an argument and add it to the UpTable
      void insereSortie(int x, int y)
      inserts the exit of the level at the position indicated in argument; if it already exists, it is transferred to the new position
      void insereVide(int x, int y)
      insert black dirt at the position indicated as argument
      boolean isFini()
      retrieve if the level is finished
      void refresh()
      level update function, update all Cases likely to be updated in the level, open the exit door if the conditions are met
      void refreshAnim()
      update the animation table and the type of animation of the character
      void remplirUpTable(int x, int y)
      add in the update table the boxes in the rectangle of 2 * 3 above the transmitted position
      void remUptable(Entity C)
      remove from the update table the box passed in parameter
      void setDscore(int dscore)
      set the number of diamonds needed to finish the level
      void setFini()
      puts the level to the finished state , end game
      void setHauteur(int hauteur)
      set the height of the level
      void setLongueur(int longueur)
      set the length of the level
      void setTmax(int tmax)
      set the bonus time of the level
      void trieUpTable()
      sorts the update table, the lower boxes take precedence over the highest ones
